verbose_text: Glucose influx under control conditions (lacking D-fructose) was a hyperbolic function of [D-glucose] and followed the Michaelis-Menten equation (Eqn 1) for carrier mediated transport, where J is unidirectional [3 H]-glucose influx (rhomol/mg protein x min), J max is the maximal influx rate, K M is an apparent affinity binding constant (mM), and [Glu] is the external sugar concentration (mM).
evidence: Glucose influx under control conditions (lacking D-fructose) was a hyperbolic function of [D-glucose] and followed the Michaelis-Menten equation (Eqn 1) for carrier-mediated transport
